definition[0]: a place where someone can go in order to escape from possible danger or attack
example[0]: The prime minister wanted to create a safe haven for the refugees.
definition[1]: a currency, bond, or investment that has few risks
example[1]: Dealers moved to the dollar as the traditional safe-haven currency  (=one that is unlikely to lose value).
example[2]: The recent tensions in the Middle East have triggered safe-haven buying.
definition[2]: a place for business where there are few risks, and where it is safe to invest your money etc
example[3]: In times of political turmoil, investors seek a safe haven for their funds.
